body.body: After surveying 5,000 people in France, the UK, Germany, USA and Brazil, Deezer found that 65% of respondents only listen to music they know. On a more positive note, 60% of respondents wanted to discover new music. But their quest was lost to apathy or “being too busy and feeling overwhelmed by the amount of choice available” (the two most common blockers recorded by survey respondents). Deezer calls the phenomenon outlined by their survey results as ’musical paralysis’

On a more positive note, 60% of respondents wanted to discover new music. But their quest was lost to apathy or “being too busy and feeling overwhelmed by the amount of choice available” (the two most common blockers recorded by survey respondents). Deezer calls the phenomenon outlined by their survey results as ’musical paralysis’
